intro: Vaccinium carlesii, commonly known as the Carles's blueberry, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like blueberries and cranberries. The plant produces small, acidic berries that are typically dark blue or black in color. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in cloud forests and mountainous areas. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
